snippet: Senator Charles Schumer said Monday that Apple and Google planned to meet with him to discuss a privacy loophole on smartphones that give apps unfettered access to people's personal photos. On Sunday, Mr. Schumer said that he planned to ask the...
abstract: Senator Charles Schumer said Monday that Apple and Google planned to meet with him to discuss a privacy loophole on smartphones that give apps unfettered access to people's personal photos. On Sunday, Mr. Schumer said that he planned to ask the Federal Trade Commission to investigate Apple and Google after the photo privacy situation came to light.

headline.main: Apple and Google to Meet With Senator Over Privacy
